issue.message: `TODO` call found; points to code which must be fixed prior to release
Invalid package reference in org.bouncycastle:bcpkix-jdk15to18; not included in Android: `javax.naming.directory`. Referenced from `org.bouncycastle.cert.dane.fetcher.JndiDANEFetcherFactory`.
Invalid package reference in org.bouncycastle:bcpkix-jdk15to18; not included in Android: `javax.naming`. Referenced from `org.bouncycastle.cert.dane.fetcher.JndiDANEFetcherFactory.1`.
Use SlackDispatchers.
Use Context#getDrawableCompat() instead
Use Context#getDrawableCompat() instead

Use the structured concurrent CoroutineScope#launch and Flow#collect APIs instead of reactive Flow#onEach and Flow#launchIn. Suspend calls like Flow#collect can be refactored into standalone suspend funs and mixed in with regular control flow in a suspend context, but calls that invoke CoroutineScope#launch and Flow#collect at the same time hide the suspend context, encouraging the developer to continue working in the reactive domain.

Use the structured concurrent CoroutineScope#launch and Flow#collect APIs instead of reactive Flow#onEach and Flow#launchIn. Suspend calls like Flow#collect can be refactored into standalone suspend funs and mixed in with regular control flow in a suspend context, but calls that invoke CoroutineScope#launch and Flow#collect at the same time hide the suspend context, encouraging the developer to continue working in the reactive domain.
For a stack use ArrayDeque which is more efficient internally.

The Compose Compiler cannot infer the stability of a parameter if a List<GpgIdentifier> is used in it, even if the item type is stable. You should use Kotlinx Immutable Collections instead: `identifiers: ImmutableList<GpgIdentifier>` or create an `@Immutable` wrapper for this class: `@Immutable data class IdentifiersList(val items: List<GpgIdentifier>)` See https://slackhq.github.io/compose-lints/rules/#avoid-using-unstable-collections for more information.
Should explicitly declare type here since implicit type does not specify nullness (Lazy<Array<(GitCommand<out (Any or Any?)> or GitCommand<out (Any or Any?)>?)>>)
